About Me

Patrick Magauran

I am a hobbyist teenager working on many projects in attempt to broaden my view and prepare myself for the workforce in the technology world. I take interest in Hardware Engineering, Systems Engineering and Administration, Photography, and Start to end software and web development.

Milestones

Started with a 3D printer

I bought a Hictop 3D printer. I have since learned quite a lot about operation as well as more advanced 3d modeling.

Late 2016
3D design

Started Web Design

As part of an FBLA competition, I developed a website for a theoretical Family Entertainment Center. I did not make it to state level competition, but I learned the aspects in designing a website with a blank file to start.

Late 2016
Web Developer and Designer

Started with 3D animation

For a school project, I modeled the movement and muscle connections of the human eye using Unity and blender. Available in my blog.

Late 2016
3D Animation

Started my first full embedded project

I started working on a wireless temperature sensor based on an ATTiny44 and NRF24l01+ witha central rPi hub. Taught me CPP and pure C along with encryption Algorithms. In debugging, I learned reading memory and stepping through assembler calls.

Late 2016
Hardware Engineer and Software Engineer

Started my server administration

I bought my first server, an HP DL180 G6. It runs OpenMediaVault, and some other services such as mysql, plex, and tvheadend. I have since purchased a Dell PE R715 with two 12 core processers and 24GB of RAM for virtualization.

February 2016
Systems Admin

Started Web Development

As part of someone else's Eagle Scout Project, we completely redid a local Fire Comapny's website. I learned how to develop in a group environment, gained an introduction to github, and acquired a vast majority of my HTML, CSS, and JS knowledge.

Late 2015 - Early 2016
Web Developer

Fundraising Software

My largest project at over 6000 lines, a peice of software for my Boy Scout Troop's annual fundraiser. It was my first Java Project, and I am approaching version 1.0 as of early 2017.

Early 2015
Java Developer

Started my Photography path

My family bought our first DSLR camera, a Nikon D3100. With this camera, I started to gain an eye for artistic photography. The links to my Flickr and store are in the links section.

Late 2014
Hobbyist Photographer

I started designing circuit boards

In order to mill on the CNC mill, I needed to design boards to mill. I started using Eagle and modeled a lower power board after the Arduino. Other designs include a power board for my star tracker and a wireless temperature sensor among other test designs.

Early 2014
Hardware Engineering

I started Milling

I purchased a Shapeoko 2 and some circuit board blanks. I started milling circuit boards with my first success done in mid 2016. I also milled wood, making a wedding gift for my sister.

Early 2014
CNC Experience

Started with Raspberry Pi

I was gifted a raspberry Pi. I used it as a robot controller and RGB Light strip controller, interfacing through the Arduino. Doing so gave me my first introduction to Python and a brief intorduction to web based languanges.

Late 2014.
Hardware Engineering & Software Development

Started hardware development

In late 2013, I was gifted an arduino starter kit. I didn't do much at first, but I did learn dumbed down C++ in the process

Late 2013
Hardware Engineer

Started my development career

Around the turn of 2010, I wrote my first fully fledged program - a Point of Sale software written in VB.NET.

Late 09 to Early 2010
Software Development

My Projects

Temperature Sensor Platform

This is a project based on an ATTiny44 chip that wirelessly encrypts and transmits the room temperature to a central hub.

...   ...

Home Center Dashboard

A simple dashboard forked from haegi.org, but the original repo has since been taken down. It displays data from a database in simple graphs in addition to weather and controls for home automation systems.

...   ...

Lychee

This is a web based image manager and view I forked from electerious. I modified to support sub albums, but the code was redone and rewritten since my version. I modified that version to support icons to traverse albums.

...   ...

LycheeSync

This is a python script which will traverse and watch a directory and add the respecting images to the database for the Lychee software. I forked the original script from GustavePate to allow for the subalbum feature.

...   ...

Fundraising Software

This is a peice of software written in Java which allows orders to be recorded and kept for my Boy Scout troop's annual Fundraiser. It features order/customer management, year based seperation, and a map to keep track of who to ask for orders. Source code to be released soon.
